actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Labor Standards.

official_title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to facilitate industrial home work, including sewing, knitting, and craftmaking.

summary.text: Home Employment Freedom Act of 1989 - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to permit individuals to engage in industrial homework (including sewing, knitting, jewelry, or craftmaking) or perform any service in or about their places of residence as employees of any employer covered by such Act if the employer complies with minimum wage and maximum hours requirements.

titles.title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to facilitate industrial home work, including sewing, knitting, and craftmaking.
